testCase.name: test parse method against bad setting configuration parse a not valid settings file returns an empty list
test parse method against bad setting configuration parse an undefined settings file returns an empty list
test parse method against bad setting configuration parse an empty setting file returns an empty list
test parse method against bad setting configuration parse a setting file without the key 'LOCAL' return an empty list
test parse method with correct setting configuration parse a setting file with key 'LOCAL' return the values in an array
test parse method with correct setting configuration parse a setting file with heterogeneous keys that include the key 'LOCAL' return the LOCAL's values in an array
validate bad path resource an array of paths defined as '*' is not resolved and an empty array is returned'
validate bad path resource an array of paths defined where an item is '*' is not resolved within an heterogeneous array and is excluded from the result
validate bad path resource an empty array of paths is resolved in an empty array returned
validate bad path resource a not valid path is not resolved and excluded from the result array
validate bad path resource a not valid path is not resolved and excluded from the result array within an heterogeneous array
validate bad path resource A resource with double slashes (or back slashes) are normalized before apply the search
validate path resource with correct configuration an escaped path is found on FS and its URI is returned in the result list
validate path resource with correct configuration a valid path written two times is included in the list only one time

Validate capability to return a list of dataset from settings.json Given a not defined property in setting json, empty list of dataset is returned

Validate dataset name against bad configurations Given a dataset with more than 8 chars, the UI returns an appropriate message
Validate dataset name against bad configurations Given a dataset with a prohibited char at the beginning, the UI returns an appropriate message
Validate dataset name against bad configurations Given a dataset that contains a prohibited char, the UI returns an appropriate message
Validate dataset name against correct input from the user Given a dataset no longer than 8 chars, the UI will not throw any notification message to the user
Validate dataset name against correct input from the user Given a correct dataset configuration, the UI will not throw any notification message to the user

TelemetryService information are consistent before send them to the telemetry server Given a fulfilled telemetry event, the data is correctly collected and sent to the telemetry server

TelemetryService information are consistent before send them to the telemetry server Given a fulfilled telemetry measurement event, the data is contained as part of a telemetry event and their data are sent to the telemetry server
TelemetryService information are consistent before send them to the telemetry server An empty telemetry object is not sent to the telemetry server
TelemetryService information are consistent before send them to the telemetry server A telemetry event with empty eventName is not sent to the telemetry server
TelemetryService information are consistent before send them to the telemetry server An exception telemetry event that contains event name and root cause is sent to the telemetry server
TelemetryService information are consistent before send them to the telemetry server An exception telemetry event without root cause is not sent to the telemetry server
TelemetryService information are consistent before send them to the telemetry server An exception telemetry event with a null root cause is not sent to the telemetry server
Anonymize content Given a verbose exception log content, then the information about the user is obfuscated

Telemetry key retrieval functionality is able to return a decoded existing key or a default string Given an existent flat file that contains telemetry key, then the content of that file is not empty and is returned
Telemetry key retrieval functionality is able to return a decoded existing key or a default string Given a not existent file, then the constant value for invalid telemetry key is returned
ZoweError convertError don't change ZoweError
ZoweError convertError don't change Error
ZoweError convertError converts 401 HTTP error to Invalid credentials
ZoweError convertError converts 404 HTTP error to Not found
ZoweError convertError converts HTTP ECONNREFUSED errors to ConnRefused
ZoweError convertError converts HTTP ENOTFOUND errors to ConnRefused

Resolve local copybook against bad configuration of target folders given an undefined value as list of folders, the copybook is not retrieved
Resolve local copybook against bad configuration of target folders given an empty list of folders, the copybook is not retrieved

Resolve local copybook against bad configuration of target folders given a not empty folder, a copybook that is not present in that folder is not retrivied and the uri returned is undefined
Resolve local copybook present in one or more folders specified by the user given a folder that contains the target copybook, it is found and its uri is returned
Resolve local copybook present in one or more folders specified by the user given two times the same folder that contains the target copybook, one uri is still returned

With invalid input parameters, the list of URI that represent copybook downloaded are not generated given a profile but no dataset, the result list returned is empty
With invalid input parameters, the list of URI that represent copybook downloaded are not generated given a list of dataset but no profile, the result list returned is empty

With allowed input parameters, the list of URI that represent copybook downloaded is correctly generated given profile and dataset list with one element, the result list is correctly generated with size 1
Prioritize search criteria for copybooks test suite With only a local folder defined in the settings.json, the search is applied locally

Prioritize search criteria for copybooks test suite With both local and dsn references defined in the settings.json, the search is applied on local resourcesfirst
